item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 3:00 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (175 points | 44 comments)
2. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (194 points | 71 comments)
3. Finding Signal in the Noise: Machine Learning and the Markets (Jane Street) (66 points | 19 comments)
4. Milk Kanban (307 points | 126 comments)
5. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (99 points | 2 comments)
6. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (37 points | 20 comments)
7. Imagine an Agent that can hot-reload tools. Open-source (4 points | discuss)
8. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (61 points | 22 comments)
9. Mandelbrot Set Explorer (20 points | 4 comments)
10. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (9 points | 2 comments)
11. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (41 points | 19 comments)
12. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (211 points | 134 comments)
13. Sunset Geometry (2016) (82 points | 10 comments)
14. They're Close to My Body: A Hagiography of Nine Inch Nails and Robin Finck (2020) (92 points | 52 comments)
15. Lemma for the Fundamental Theorem of Galois Theory (115 points | 29 comments)
16. Show HN: Aiopandas – Async .apply() and .map() for Pandas, Faster API/LLMs Calls (31 points | 4 comments)
17. Parahelp (YC S24) Is Hiring Founding Engineers (SF) ( | hide)
18. Career Advice in 2025 (8 points | discuss)
19. Computers and Mice – Mister Rogers Neighborhood (92 points | 24 comments)
20. AutoHete: An Automatic and Efficient Heterogeneous Training System for LLMs (27 points | discuss)
21. What Bikini Atoll Looks Like Today (2017) (118 points | 46 comments)
22. Arbitrary-Scale Super-Resolution with Neural Heat Fields (132 points | 44 comments)
23. I outsourced my memory to an AI pin and all I got was fanfiction (13 points | 2 comments)
24. So Long and Thanks for All the Words: A Toast to Douglas Adams (197 points | 73 comments)
25. A look at Firefox forks (505 points | 337 comments)
26. Show HN: Fashion Shopping with Nearest Neighbors (60 points | 19 comments)
27. Briar: Peer to Peer Encrypted Messaging (405 points | 167 comments)
28. RubyLLM: A delightful Ruby way to work with AI (601 points | 159 comments)
29. Show HN: Metacheck – preview how any link appears on social media and chat apps (130 points | 30 comments)
30. Transformers Without Normalization (236 points | 30 comments)
